text.__SUMMARY__: Gymnopilus flavidellus is a species of mushroom in the Cortinariaceae family.
text.Description: The cap is 2 to 5 centimetres (0.8 to 2.0 in) in diameter.
text.Habitat and distribution: Gymnopilus flavidellus grows on coniferous and deciduous wood, such as stumps, buried wood, fallen limbs, and sawdust. It may be found in most of temperate North America, fruiting from autumn to winter.
